about.title: About the Journal of Digital History
about.subheading: The Journal of Digital History (JDH) is a joint initiative of the Luxembourg Centre for Contemporary and Digital History (C¬≤DH) at the University of Luxembourg and the De Gruyter publishing group.

articles.title: Articles & Issues
articles.subheading: Filter by keywords, libraries or browse the articles.

abstractSubmitted.title: Congratulations !
abstractSubmitted.heading: Your abstract has been successfully submitted. Below is a summary of your submission. Our editors will contact you shortly using the contact email address provided in the form.
abstractSubmitted.moreInfo: If you need to update any information, please reach out to us at jdh.admin@uni.lu.

errorViewer.title: Ouch! Something wrong happened...
errorViewer.subheading: How can I get rid of this message?
errorViewer.message:
JDH needs you when errors happen.
Please contact jdh.admin@uni.lu copy pasting the code below.

abstractSubmission.title: Abstract Submission
abstractSubmission.guidelines: Please, do not hesitate to read our guidelines before submitting.

author.explanation:
Please provide the contact information of all authors and contributors. At least one author must provide a GitHub username and one author must be designated as the primary contact. These can be different individuals.

The order of the authors will determine the final sequence in the published article.
author.name: Name

orcid.helptext: Don't have an ORCID yet? Create one at orcid.org for free!

github.helptext: Don't have a GitHub account yet? Create one at github.com for free!

author.primaryContact: <em className='text-accent'>Use this author as primary contact<em className='text-accent'>

article.title: Title
article.abstractHelpText: When addressing the multi-layered principle of JDH articles, please provide a detailed description of the narrative layer, the hermeneutic layer, and the data layer.

dataset.explanation: If you wish to share your data, please provide a description. Include details about your findings, the tools or methods used, and any potential biases.

repository.explanation: Once your abstract is accepted, we will create a dedicated repository for your article on Github. This repository includes a structured template and Github actions to streamline the writing process.

abstractSubmission.requiredFieldExplanation: All field marked with an asterisk (*) are required

placeholder.title: Title
placeholder.description: Description of the dataset, tools or code URL

tooltips.orcidUrl: Providing an ORCID (Open Researcher and Contributor ID) helps uniquely identify each author and ensures proper attribution of their work.
tooltips.githubId: The Github username will be used to create a repository for your article.
tooltips.blueskyId: When your article is published, we promote it on Bluesky. If you would like to be tagged in our posts, you can provide your username here.
tooltips.facebookId: When your article is published, we promote it on Facebook. If you would like to be tagged in our posts, you can provide your username here.

abstractSubmission.socialMediaExplanation: When your article is published, we promote it on Bluesky and Facebook. If you would like to be tagged, you can provide your username(s).
abstractSubmission.recaptchaDisclaimer: This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.
abstractSubmission.termsAcceptance: I have read and I accept the terms and conditions available at Terms of use

errors.callForPapersRequired: Please select a call for papers

email.format: Must be a valid email address

confirmEmail.format: Must be a valid email address

orcidUrl.pattern: Must be a valid ORCID URL as https://orcid.org/0000-0000-0000-0000

githubId.pattern: Must be a valid Github ID as your-username or username
githubId.githubApiError: Error retrieving user data from Github API
githubId.atLeastOneGithubId: At least one author must have a valid Github Username

blueskyId.pattern: Must be a valid Bluesky ID as username.bsky.social

facebookId.pattern: Must be a valid Facebook ID as username

primaryContact.atLeastOnePrimaryContact: At least one author must be selected as primary contact

languagePreference.enum: Please select a programming language for your repository

termsAccepted.enum: You must accept the terms of use

errors.submitError: There are errors in your submission. Please fix them before submitting.
